column1: Two hundred and thirty-nine girl voices chanted the Wo-he-lo Cheer with weird impressiveness. The scene alone would have been impressive enough
column2: but Camp Fire Girls are not satisfied with that kind of "enough." Once their imagination is stimulated with the almost limitless possibilities of the craft
column3: they are not easily pleased with anything but a finished product.The occasion was the last Grand Council Fire of Hiawatha Institute for Camp Fire Girls located in the Allegheny city of Westmoreland. The classroom work had been rushed a day ahead
column5: and for them also the clock had been turned twenty-four hours forward. The curriculum was finished
column6: and the day just closed had been devoted to preparation for a Grand Council wind-up for the fifteen Fires of the Institute
column7: which would "break ranks" on the following day and scatter in all directions for home and the Christmas holidays.
